metadata.title: CVE-2015-1330 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
unattended-upgrades before 0.86.1 does not properly authenticate packageswhen the (1) force-confold or (2) force-confnew dpkg options are enabled inthe DPkg::Options::* apt configuration, which allows remoteman-in-the-middle attackers to upload and execute arbitrary packages viaunspecified vectors.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2015-1330` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

unattended-upgrades - 0.82.1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: unattended-upgrades package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.82.1ubuntu2.3').
